semantic_identifier: 47: feat: Ingestion: add configurable batching + backpressure to cap concurrency and prevent queue blowups

sections.text:
## Description

This PR implements batching and backpressure controls across the ingestion pipeline to keep throughput stable during large backfills without overwhelming the DB or downstream sync.

Key changes
- Adds per-stage configuration for batch size and concurrency limits for fetch/parse/dedupe/persist.
- Reworks stage runners to process work-items in bounded batches and to enforce a global in-flight cap (preventing unbounded fan-out).
- Introduces backpressure based on runtime signals:
  - queue depth thresholds (high/low watermarks) to pause/resume ingestion sources
  - elevated retry/error rates to reduce concurrency and/or temporarily pause consumers
- Adds a lightweight rate controller that adjusts stage concurrency within configured min/max bounds and emits structured logs/metrics for visibility.

Idempotency + retries
- Ensures batch processing remains idempotent by keeping existing dedupe keys and upsert semantics and by making batch commits safe to retry.
- Changes retry handling to re-enqueue items with jittered backoff while preserving idempotency (no duplicate DB writes; safe reprocessing when throttling triggers retries).

Configuration
- New config knobs (with safe defaults) for:
  - BATCH_SIZE_{FETCH,PARSE,DEDUPE,PERSIST}
  - CONCURRENCY_{FETCH,PARSE,DEDUPE,PERSIST}
  - INFLIGHT_MAX
  - BACKPRESSURE_QUEUE_HIGH/LOW_WATERMARK
  - BACKPRESSURE_RETRY_RATE_THRESHOLD + PAUSE_DURATION

Operational notes
- When backpressure engages, sources are paused and/or concurrency is reduced; ingestion resumes automatically once queue depth and retry rates recover.
- No API changes; behavior is controlled via configuration and can be tuned per environment.

## How Has This Been Tested?
